name: woodenteeth
text: Wouldn't rehearsals kinda mean he could do without the intepreter at shows? Just sayin' is all. I hope so. Wouldn't even be able to get the audiences adoring looks...

name: mastronaut
text: You don't rehearse the blues. You feel it and let it flow. Because you too damn poor to rehearse anyways. Because the one time you did, the cost of rehearsal was a dollar, and you only made fifty cents at the show.

name: woodenteeth
text: Heh. Sounds like any kind of musical venture pre-Sony deal.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zorque, Norsef, instantkarma, LordPretzel, zaer, usversusthem, Doc_Rostov)

name: numberkillinger
text: I have some sony headphones. they are ok.

name: dopamine
text: my playstation gives me many, many good hours

name: semiquaver
text: Yeah so does mine.

name: notcool
text: 252.99 million other people also get many, many good hours from their various iterations of PlayStations, not including the PSP, which is Sinful.

name: soticoto
text: A similar number get many, many "good hours" from crack...  Doesn't mean it isn't total bloody evil.

name: terriblerobot
text: So...Why are you so militantly against Sony? Did they make you watch as they raped your puppy or something when you were just a small child?

name: soticoto
text:
Yes.

... If by "puppy" you mean "Sega Saturn", then "Dreamcast".

name: terriblerobot
text: Hm...touche. Although Sony originally got into the whole console game as a big "fuck you" to Nintendo. Seems like Sega just got in the way and was run over. Repeatedly. I did like the Dreamcast though, it was a sad day when it died.

name: soticoto
text: Ken Kutaragi must suffer for his crimes against my childhood.

name: terriblerobot
text: This made me laugh quite loudly, chub for you.

name: alilsneaky
text:
This made me laugh so hard.
Don't feel sorry for sega btw, after their ridiculous sega cd addon they deserved to go down in a fiery blaze. (If sega goes down in a fiery blaze and noone is around to buy it does it still leave a scorchmark?)

name: tonyhighwind
text: I like to think I have an extensive vocabulary, but I really can't come up with an adjective that properly conveys how true that is.

name: kaithekender
text: Do the blues require that one comes from Circumstances?

name: ktistecmachine
text: Aolisius tears me up with his fine, white notes and deaf, deaf ears. I want to see him perform, that terrible, crippled miracle, and bawl.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Just his luck.

name: stuart
text: Ray's grandpa was Rustmouth. Beef's grandpa was Aloisius.

name: apocowarg
text: I feel a sense of sorrow for having been born too late to hear the blues played by crippled imaginary cats.

name: cailetshadow
text: The lights are low because we are in Story Time.

name: ruralelecric
text: i am certain with out a doubt that this is the greatest comic written ever this is wonderfully depressing and killing all of you slowly

name: soticoto
text: Softly.

name: dr_strangeglove
text: with its words.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
rustmouth and aloisius were rivals, ray and beef are best friends.

huh.

name: epicurus
text: "Audiences wept that he could not know the miracle of his own singing" caused me to upgrade this from 4 to 5 today. This arc is actually extremely rewarding, especially to the reader who don't mind a bit of text in their tittie.

name: semiquaver
text: Text in one's tittie is a tragic medical condition.

name: tslothrop
text: "The whole performance was something of a terrible, crippled miracle."  What an amazing line.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: That BITCH.
Molly: The Achewood A-List! December 19, 2006

"WHAT THE FUCK IS YOUR FUCKING PROBLEM YOU BITCH YOUR CUNT IS REAL ESTATE AND ITALIANS THROW FRUIT AT YOUR MIND!"

name: i_love_kate
text: Pat stalks a woman for cutting him off in traffic.

name: tekende
text: Vintage Pat: "I couldn't cash a check for a shit and two peanuts with what I think of you."

name: terribleman
text: Ray finds it easier to just appear outside.

name: woodenteeth
text: What happened to the rest of the comments on this comic. There is no way I was the first to comment when I posted what you see at the head of the page.

name: i_love_kate
text:
The prospect of Assetbar comments disappearing has me too terrified to reply.

Oh, wait.

name: woodenteeth
text: I like to help people overcome their fears through solidarity.

name: wartooth
text: this is the saddest thing ever...

name: panamajack
text: The last panel could be one of the greatest Arts in the history of this strip.

name: genequagmire
text: And that's gotta be Blind Lemon Jefferson!  Mystery solved!

name: duperando
text:
Imagine watching that show. Sitting there and watching the interpreter read the music, then signing to the singer, then he sings the words.
Thus, there's a strange delay, depending on how fast the interpreter signs.
Basically, it would be hilarious.
